</li>
<li id="cite_note-Friedersdorf-190508-75"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Friedersdorf-190508_75-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFFriedersdorf2019"><a href="/wiki/Conor_Friedersdorf" title="Conor Friedersdorf">Friedersdorf, Conor</a> (May 8, 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/05/trump-taxes/588967/" rel="nofollow">"The Secret That Was Hiding in Trump's Taxes"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Atlantic" title="The Atlantic">The Atlantic</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Venook-175"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Venook_175-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Venook_175-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Venook_175-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Venook_175-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFVenook2017">Venook, Jeremy (August 9, 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2017/08/donald-trump-conflicts-of-interests/508382/" rel="nofollow">"Trump's Interests vs. America's, Dubai Edition"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Atlantic" title="The Atlantic">The Atlantic</a></i>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Atlantic&amp;rft.atitle=Trump%27s+Interests+vs.+America%27s%2C+Dubai+Edition&amp;rft.date=2017-08-09&amp;rft.aulast=Venook&amp;rft.aufirst=Jeremy&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theatlantic.com%2Fbusiness%2Farchive%2F2017%2F08%2Fdonald-trump-conflicts-of-interests%2F508382%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-CRSRpt-176"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-CRSRpt_176-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CRSRpt_176-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CRSRpt_176-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation report cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://fas.org/sgp/crs/misc/IF11086.pdf" rel="nofollow">In Focus: The Emoluments Clauses of the U.S. Constitution</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (Report). Congressional Research Service. August 19, 2020.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=report&amp;rft.btitle=In+Focus%3A+The+Emoluments+Clauses+of+the+U.S.+Constitution&amp;rft.pub=Congressional+Research+Service&amp;rft.date=2020-08-19&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ffas.org%2Fsgp%2Fcrs%2Fmisc%2FIF11086.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Cillizza-160614-240"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Cillizza-160614_240-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Cillizza-160614_240-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFCillizza2016"><a href="/wiki/Chris_Cillizza" title="Chris Cillizza">Cillizza, Chris</a> (June 14, 2016). <a class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2016/06/14/this-harvard-study-is-a-powerful-indictment-of-the-medias-role-in-donald-trumps-rise/" rel="nofollow">"This Harvard study is a powerful indictment of the media's role in Donald Trump's rise"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Washington_Post" title="The Washington Post">The Washington Post</a></i>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Washington+Post&amp;rft.atitle=This+Harvard+study+is+a+powerful+indictment+of+the+media%27s+role+in+Donald+Trump%27s+rise&amp;rft.date=2016-06-14&amp;rft.aulast=Cillizza&amp;rft.aufirst=Chris&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.washingtonpost.com%2Fnews%2Fthe-fix%2Fwp%2F2016%2F06%2F14%2Fthis-harvard-study-is-a-powerful-indictment-of-the-medias-role-in-donald-trumps-rise%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-256"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-256">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFNelson2017">Nelson, Libby (August 12, 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.vox.com/2017/8/12/16138358/charlottesville-protests-david-duke-kkk" rel="nofollow">"<span class="cs1-kern-left">"</span>Why we voted for Donald Trump": David Duke explains the white supremacist Charlottesville protests"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Vox_(website)" title="Vox (website)">Vox</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-334"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-334">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/3480299-10-Examples-Industries-Push-Followed-by-Trump.html#document/p60/a341284" rel="nofollow">"Trump-Era Trend: Industries Protest. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">March 7,</span> 2017</span> – via <a href="/wiki/DocumentCloud" title="DocumentCloud">DocumentCloud</a>. <q>More than 90 Obama-era federal regulations have been revoked or delayed or enforcement has been suspended, in many cases based on requests from the industries the rules target.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Trump-Era+Trend%3A+Industries+Protest.+Regulations+Rolled+Back.+A+Dozen+Examples&amp;rft.date=2017-03-05&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.documentcloud.org%2Fdocuments%2F3480299-10-Examples-Industries-Push-Followed-by-Trump.html%23document%2Fp60%2Fa341284&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-335"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-335">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFPlumer2017">Plumer, Brad (January 30, 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.vox.com/science-and-health/2017/1/30/14441430/trump-executive-order-regulations" rel="nofollow">"Trump wants to kill two old regulations for every new one issued. <li id="cite_note-Nakamura-190109-425"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Nakamura-190109_425-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFNakamuraKim2019"><a href="/wiki/David_Nakamura" title="David Nakamura">Nakamura, David</a>; <a href="/wiki/Seung_Min_Kim" title="Seung Min Kim">Kim, Seung Min</a> (January 9, 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/hes-a-gut-politician-trumps-go-to-negotiating-tactics-not-working-in-shutdown-standoff/2019/01/09/c7bb5ff2-142b-11e9-b6ad-9cfd62dbb0a8_story.html" rel="nofollow">"<span class="cs1-kern-left">'</span>He's a gut politician': Trump's go-to negotiating tactics aren't working in shutdown standoff"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Washington_Post" title="The Washington Post">The Washington Post</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-452"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-452">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFCarothersBrown2019">Carothers, Thomas; Brown, Frances Z. <li id="cite_note-AP180508-482"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-AP180508_482-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-AP180508_482-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFLederman2018">Lederman, Josh (May 8, 2018). <a class="external text" href="https://apnews.com/cead755353a1455bbef08ef289448994/Trump-decides-to-exit-nuclear-accord-with-Iran" rel="nofollow">"Trump declares US leaving 'horrible' Iran nuclear accord"</a>. <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/AP_News" title="AP News">AP News</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Declassified_Report-720"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Declassified_Report_720-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/01/06/us/politics/document-russia-hacking-report-intelligence-agencies.html" rel="nofollow">"Intelligence Report on Russian Hacking"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i>. January 6, 2017. p. ii<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">January 8,</span> 2017</span>. <q>We assess Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered an influence campaign in 2016 aimed at the U.S. presidential election. Russia's goals were to undermine public faith in the U.S. democratic process, denigrate Secretary <a href="/wiki/Hillary_Clinton" title="Hillary Clinton">Clinton</a>, and harm her electability and potential presidency. We further assess Putin and the Russian Government developed a clear preference for President-elect Trump. We have high confidence in these judgments.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Intelligence+Report+on+Russian+Hacking&amp;rft.pages=ii&amp;rft.date=2017-01-06&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2Finteractive%2F2017%2F01%2F06%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fdocument-russia-hacking-report-intelligence-agencies.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-735"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-735">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFSchmidt2020"><a href="/wiki/Michael_S._Schmidt" title="Michael S. <li id="cite_note-736"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-736">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFMeyer2020">Meyer, Ken (September 13, 2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.mediaite.com/tv/peter-strzok-defends-belief-trump-compromised-by-russia-their-leverage-renders-him-incapable-of-defending-national-interest/" rel="nofollow">"Peter Strzok Defends Belief Trump 'Compromised' by Russia: Their Leverage Renders Him 'Incapable' of Defending National Interest"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Mediaite" title="Mediaite">Mediaite</a></i>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Mediaite&amp;rft.atitle=Peter+Strzok+Defends+Belief+Trump+%27Compromised%27+by+Russia%3A+Their+Leverage+Renders+Him+%27Incapable%27+of+Defending+National+Interest&amp;rft.date=2020-09-13&amp;rft.aulast=Meyer&amp;rft.aufirst=Ken&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mediaite.com%2Ftv%2Fpeter-strzok-defends-belief-trump-compromised-by-russia-their-leverage-renders-him-incapable-of-defending-national-interest%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Mueller_Report-737"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Mueller_Report_737-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Mueller_Report_737-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFMueller2019">Mueller, Robert S. III (March 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.justice.gov/storage/report.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Report On The Investigation Into Russian Interference In The 2016 Presidential Election"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. U.S. Department of Justice. <q>The Russian government interfered in the 2016 presidential election in sweeping and systematic fashion. [...] In connection with that analysis, we addressed the factual question whether members of the Trump Campaign 'coordinat[ed]' – a term that appears in the appointment order – with Russian election interference activities. Like collusion, 'coordination' does not have a settled definition in federal criminal law. We understood coordination to require an agreement – tacit or express – between the Trump Campaign and the Russian government on election interference. That requires more than the two parties taking actions that were informed by or responsive to the other's actions or interests. We applied the term coordination in that sense when stating in the report that the investigation did not establish that the Trump Campaign coordinated with the Russian government in its election interference activities.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Report+On+The+Investigation+Into+Russian+Interference+In+The+2016+Presidential+Election&amp;rft.pub=U.S.+Department+of+Justice&amp;rft.date=2019-03&amp;rft.aulast=Mueller&amp;rft.aufirst=Robert+S.+III&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.justice.gov%2Fstorage%2Freport.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Rosenstein_5/17/2017-738"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Rosenstein_5/17/2017_738-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Rosenstein_5/17/2017_738-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFRosenstein2017">Rosenstein, Rod (May 17, 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2017/05/17/us/politics/document-Robert-Mueller-Special-Counsel-Russia.html" rel="nofollow">"Rod Rosenstein's Letter Appointing Mueller Special Counsel"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 18,</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Rod+Rosenstein%27s+Letter+Appointing+Mueller+Special+Counsel&amp;rft.date=2017-05-17&amp;rft.aulast=Rosenstein&amp;rft.aufirst=Rod&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2Finteractive%2F2017%2F05%2F17%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fdocument-Robert-Mueller-Special-Counsel-Russia.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Vitkovskaya-739"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Vitkovskaya_739-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFVitkovskaya2017">Vitkovskaya, Julie (June 16, 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/06/15/the-president-is-under-investigation-for-obstruction-of-justice-how-did-we-get-here/" rel="nofollow">"Trump Is Officially under Investigation. How Did We Get Here?"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Washington_Post" title="The Washington Post">The Washington Post</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-754"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-754">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFBump2019">Bump, Philip (May 30, 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/05/30/trump-briefly-acknowledges-that-russia-aided-his-election-falsely-says-he-didnt-help-effort/" rel="nofollow">"Trump briefly acknowledges that Russia aided his election – and falsely says he didn't help the effort"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Washington_Post" title="The Washington Post">The Washington Post</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-768"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-768">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFHerbBrown2019">Herb, Jeremy; <a href="/wiki/Pamela_Brown_(journalist)" title="Pamela Brown (journalist)">Brown, Pamela</a> (March 21, 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/21/politics/trump-putin-white-house-rejects/index.html" rel="nofollow">"White House rejects Dem requests for info on Putin communications"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/CNN" title="CNN">CNN</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Glasser-180803-851"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Glasser-180803_851-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Glasser-180803_851-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFGlasser2018"><a href="/wiki/Susan_Glasser" title="Susan Glasser">Glasser, Susan</a> (August 3, 2018). <a class="external text" href="https://www.newyorker.com/news/letter-from-trumps-washington/trumps-escalating-war-on-the-truth-is-on-purpose" rel="nofollow">"It's True: Trump Is Lying More, and He's Doing It on Purpose"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_Yorker" title="The New Yorker">The New Yorker</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-857"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-857">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFKesslerRizzoKelly2020"><a href="/wiki/Glenn_Kessler_(journalist)" title="Glenn Kessler (journalist)">Kessler, Glenn</a>; Rizzo, Salvador; Kelly, Meg (January 20, 2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/01/20/president-trump-made-16241-false-or-misleading-claims-his-first-three-years/" rel="nofollow">"President Trump made 16,241 false or misleading claims in his first three years"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Washington_Post" title="The Washington Post">The Washington Post</a></i>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Washington+Post&amp;rft.atitle=President+Trump+made+16%2C241+false+or+misleading+claims+in+his+first+three+years&amp;rft.date=2020-01-20&amp;rft.aulast=Kessler&amp;rft.aufirst=Glenn&amp;rft.au=Rizzo%2C+Salvador&amp;rft.au=Kelly%2C+Meg&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.washingtonpost.com%2Fpolitics%2F2020%2F01%2F20%2Fpresident-trump-made-16241-false-or-misleading-claims-his-first-three-years%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-PolitiFact_1/21/2017-858"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-PolitiFact_1/21/2017_858-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFQiu2017">Qiu, Linda (January 21, 2017). <a class="external text" href="http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/statements/2017/jan/21/sean-spicer/trump-had-biggest-inaugural-crowd-ever-metrics-don/" rel="nofollow">"Donald Trump had biggest inaugural crowd ever? <li id="cite_note-nation-20170508-898"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-nation-20170508_898-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nation-20170508_898-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFMcElweeMcDaniel2017">McElwee, Sean; McDaniel, Jason (May 8, 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.thenation.com/article/economic-anxiety-didn't-make-people-vote-trump-racism-did/" rel="nofollow">"Economic Anxiety Didn't Make People Vote Trump, Racism Did"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Nation" title="The Nation">The Nation</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-912"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-912">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFSchaffnerMacwilliamsNteta2018"><a href="/wiki/Brian_Schaffner" title="Brian Schaffner">Schaffner, Brian F.</a>; Macwilliams, Matthew; Nteta, Tatishe (March 2018). "Understanding White Polarization in the 2016 Vote for President: The Sobering Role of Racism and Sexism". <i><a href="/wiki/Political_Science_Quarterly" title="Political Science Quarterly">Political Science Quarterly</a></i>. <b>133</b> (1): 9–34. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1002%2Fpolq.12737" rel="nofollow">10.1002/polq.12737</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Political+Science+Quarterly&amp;rft.atitle=Understanding+White+Polarization+in+the+2016+Vote+for+President%3A+The+Sobering+Role+of+Racism+and+Sexism&amp;rft.volume=133&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=9-34&amp;rft.date=2018-03&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1002%2Fpolq.12737&amp;rft.aulast=Schaffner&amp;rft.aufirst=Brian+F.&amp;rft.au=Macwilliams%2C+Matthew&amp;rft.au=Nteta%2C+Tatishe&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-942"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-942">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFGarber2017">Garber, Megan (April 3, 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2017/04/donald-trump-impression-gets-a-comedy-central-show/521718/" rel="nofollow">"<span class="cs1-kern-left">'</span>Donald Trump' Gets a Comedy Central Series"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Atlantic" title="The Atlantic">The Atlantic</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGallup1990"><a href="/wiki/George_Gallup_Jr." title="George Gallup Jr.">Gallup, George Jr.</a> (1990). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=G7Tf_1GzlHEC" rel="nofollow"><i>The Gallup Poll: Public Opinion 1989</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Rowman_%26_Littlefield" title="Rowman &amp; Littlefield">Rowman &amp; Littlefield</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8420-2344-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8420-2344-3"><bdi>978-0-8420-2344-3</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Gallup+Poll%3A+Public+Opinion+1989&amp;rft.pub=Rowman+%26+Littlefield&amp;rft.date=1990&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8420-2344-3&amp;rft.aulast=Gallup&amp;rft.aufirst=George+Jr.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DG7Tf_1GzlHEC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFPacelle2001">Pacelle, Mitchell (2001). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/empire00mitc" rel="nofollow"><i>Empire: A Tale of Obsession, Betrayal, and the Battle for an American Icon</i></a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/John_Wiley_%26_Sons" title="John Wiley &amp; Sons">John Wiley &amp; Sons</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-471-23865-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-471-23865-2"><bdi>978-0-471-23865-2</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Empire%3A+A+Tale+of+Obsession%2C+Betrayal%2C+and+the+Battle+for+an+American+Icon&amp;rft.pub=John+Wiley+%26+Sons&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-471-23865-2&amp;rft.aulast=Pacelle&amp;rft.aufirst=Mitchell&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fempire00mitc&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFKranishFisher2017"><a href="/wiki/Michael_Kranish" title="Michael Kranish">Kranish, Michael</a>; <a href="/wiki/Marc_Fisher" title="Marc Fisher">Fisher, Marc</a> (2017) [First published 2016]. <a href="/wiki/Trump_Revealed" title="Trump Revealed"><i>Trump Revealed: The Definitive Biography of the 45th President</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Simon_%26_Schuster" title="Simon &amp; Schuster">Simon &amp; Schuster</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-5011-5652-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-5011-5652-6"><bdi>978-1-5011-5652-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Trump+Revealed%3A+The+Definitive+Biography+of+the+45th+President&amp;rft.pub=Simon+%26+Schuster&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-5011-5652-6&amp;rft.aulast=Kranish&amp;rft.aufirst=Michael&amp;rft.au=Fisher%2C+Marc&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ADonald+Trump"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFO'DonnellRutherford1991">O'Donnell, John R.; Rutherford, James (1991) [First published 1991]. <a href="/wiki/Trumped!_(book)" title="Trumped!
